DataElement.preferredName: Charlson Comorbidity Index Chart Review Version Has Other Metastatic Solid Tumor Specify Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text field for another type of solid tumor(s) an individual has or had that is different from previously identified options, determined by reviewing information from the medical record.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Charlson Comorbidity Index Chart Review Version Has Other Metastatic Solid Tumor
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A method of predicting mortality by weighting comorbid conditions calculated by reviewing an individual's chart._Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned._A term referring to the clinical or pathologic observation of a tumor extension from its original site of growth to another anatomic site._A benign or malignant neoplasm arising from tissues that do not include fluid areas.  Representative examples include epithelial neoplasms (e.g. lung carcinoma, prostate carcinoma, breast carcinoma, colon carcinoma), and neoplasms arising from the soft tissues and bones (e.g. leiomyosarcoma, liposarcoma, chondrosarcoma, osteosarcoma).  Neoplasms originating from the blood or bone marrow (leukemias and myeloproliferative disorders) are not considered solid tumors.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Charlson Comorbidity Index Chart Review Version
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A method of predicting mortality by weighting comorbid conditions calculated by reviewing an individual's chart.

Concepts.longName: Charlson Comorbidity Index Derived from Chart Review
Concepts.definition: A method of predicting mortality by weighting comorbid conditions calculated by reviewing an individual's chart.

Property.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.:A term referring to the clinical or pathologic observation of a tumor extension from its original site of growth to another anatomic site.:Cancer of body tissues other than blood, bone marrow, or the lymphatic system.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
A term referring to the clinical or pathologic observation of a tumor extension from its original site of growth to another anatomic site.

A benign or malignant neoplasm arising from tissues that do not include fluid areas.  Representative examples include epithelial neoplasms (e.g. lung carcinoma, prostate carcinoma, breast carcinoma, colon carcinoma), and neoplasms arising from the soft tissues and bones (e.g. leiomyosarcoma, liposarcoma, chondrosarcoma, osteosarcoma).  Neoplasms originating from the blood or bone marrow (leukemias and myeloproliferative disorders) are not considered solid tumors.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Top level term which includes Biological Markers, Risk Factors, and Prognostic Factors.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The free text field that describes another response when other is chosen from a list of values.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
